page.title: 10WETHERBY PLANNING SYSTEM
page.content: The West Yorkshire Structure Plan lays down general guidelines for the planning of the whole of the local region. The Wetherby District Plan, produced by the Leeds City Council provides a more detailed plan for the area. In drawing up the local Plan the Planning Committee has to consult with interested parties and the general public. The Planning Officer decides which land in an area is for housing and other needs. A builder has to obtain planning permission by sending plans to the Development Control Planning Officer who checks that no regulations have been broken. The plans then go to the Planning Committee with his recommendations. They decide if they should be approved. If they are not the builder can appeal to the Secretary of State for the Environment.
